dishes.name: Bolognese Zucchini
ingredients: to taste spices (salt, pepper, oregano, garlic, basil..)
preparation: Peel the zucchinis and slice them thinly, then cut them lengthwise to get spaghetti-like strands; there is also a tool available for this at Chinese stores. Let them drain, and in the meantime, prepare the sauce. Finely chop the onion, add the meat, and sauté until the meat changes color. Add the tomato sauce and simmer for another 10 minutes on low heat. Add the drained zucchinis and sauté together for another 10-15 minutes, finally adding spices to taste and preference. When done, you can immediately grate cheese or serve it on the side.

dishes.name: Stuffed Peppers with Potatoes
preparation: Clean the onion, garlic, leek, and carrot, and chop everything into small cubes (in a chopper). In a larger pot, pour in oil and heat it (about 150 ml of oil). Add the chopped vegetables to the heated oil and sauté on medium heat just until softened. Add the cleaned and coarsely grated potatoes and sauté for another 10 minutes, stirring. Finally, add the ajvar, chopped parsley, and all the listed spices. Mix well, remove from heat, and let cool.

Clean the seeds and stems from the peppers. Grease a baking dish with oil (you can also use any other non-stick dish). Stuff the peppers, sprinkle flour over each opening (there's no need to close them with tomato or potato), and arrange them in the dish. Distribute the remaining filling between the peppers.

Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. Just cover the dish with foil, but leave an opening on the side so that the peppers bake instead of boiling. Bake the peppers under foil for 45 minutes. Then, carefully remove the foil, brush the peppers with oil using a silicone brush, and return to the oven to brown.
A very tasty lunch...

dishes.name: Crispy Spiced White Meat
ingredients: a few tablespoons of breadcrumbs and flour
preparation: Cut the white meat into smaller pieces, either into steaks or elongated pieces. Place the meat in a bowl and sprinkle it with a mixture of all the spices and mix.
In a bowl, pour in the flour, milk, paprika, a little salt, and the egg, and mix well with a fork until you get a smooth mixture.
Dip each piece of meat into the mixture, drain a little, and roll in the mixture of flour and breadcrumbs, then fry in oil until golden.
Breadcrumbs are not included in the recipe, but I added them to make the meat even crispier.
Place the fried meat on a paper towel, then serve with sides, i.e., sauces (dips) and salad.

dishes.name: Pork Ribs with Potatoes
ingredients: 1 smallest teaspoon of chopped tomato sauce (ready-made product)
preparation: With a sharp knife, score the skin on the ribs and salt them.In a small bowl, mix the pesto, chopped tomato sauce, and Mediterranean herb mix, and rub this mixture all over the pork.

Peel, wash, and slice the potatoes thinly and salt them.In a baking dish, add a little oil, then the sliced potatoes and the ribs.Bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees for about an hour and a half, basting with wine and a little water during baking.

dishes.name: Simple: Pilaf
preparation: Cut the meat into smaller pieces and boil: when it starts to boil, cook for about ten minutes. Remove from water to cool, then cut into small cubes, saving the water.Boil the rice in salted water: the cooking time depends on whether you are preparing glutinous or whole grain rice. It should soften but not overcook as it will continue to simmer in the oven.In oil, sauté finely chopped onion, garlic, and carrot.

To the sautéed onion with carrot, add the chopped meat, boiled rice with not too much liquid from the rice, but if needed, add the broth in which the meat was cooked so that it is mushy but not too runny. Simmer for 5-6 minutes. Season with salt and pepper to taste, add vegetable seasoning and finely chopped parsley (fresh or dried), mix well, and transfer to a greased baking dish.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for about 30 minutes to evaporate excess liquid and to blend the flavors.

dishes.name: Baked Beans with Cheese
ingredients: oil as needed and to taste
preparation: Cook the beans in the usual way. Soak in water overnight, discard the first cooking water, and cook while occasionally adding hot water until cooked.Sauté finely chopped red onion in oil, add paprika, briefly fry, add crumbled white cheese, remove from heat, and add finely chopped parsley. Add the cooked and drained beans. Mix and season to taste (depends on how salty the cheese is).
Pour into a greased smaller baking dish, sprinkle with a little finely chopped fresh or dried parsley, and bake in the oven at 180 degrees for about half an hour.

dishes.name: Pizza Macaroni
preparation: Cook the macaroni according to the package instructions, drain, and let cool. Add sour cream, milk, oil, tomato sauce, chopped salami, 100 g grated cheese, oregano, salt, pepper, dry vegetable seasoning to the macaroni and mix to combine all ingredients. Pour the prepared macaroni into a greased baking dish. Top with 150 g grated cheese and bake in a well-heated oven at 200 degrees for 20 minutes.
Remove the baked macaroni from the oven, let cool, and serve.

dishes.name: Macaroni with Chicken
preparation: Cook the macaroni according to the package instructions. Drain and let cool, then add 180 g sour cream and mix. In heated oil, sauté finely chopped chicken white meat. When browned, season with salt and add a little water and sauté briefly until the water evaporates. Then add 180 g sour cream, season to taste (add salt, pepper, and oregano) and simmer for a few minutes before removing from heat. Distribute the macaroni with sour cream on plates, and top with the meat and sour cream sauce. Sprinkle with oregano and serve.

dishes.name: Turkey in Soy Sauce
preparation: Wash and dry the meat. For the marinade, mix soy sauce with ketchup, orange juice, honey, and spices - be careful with salt, as soy sauce is salty...Rub the turkey well with the marinade and let it rest for at least 2 hours, preferably overnight...Preheat the oven, arrange the meat in a baking dish, add the marinade if any is left, cover with foil, and bake.About halfway through the time - one to one and a half hours. Remove the baking dish, take out the meat, place the cleaned and seasoned potatoes, return the turkey, cover again with foil, and continue baking. When both the meat and potatoes are cooked, remove the foil and let it brown nicely.Serve with a seasonal salad.

dishes.name: Stuffed Peppers Baked in the Oven
ingredients: to taste salt, ground black pepper
preparation: In a deeper pan, sauté the onion and garlic with 2 tablespoons of lard, then add the ground meat and spices. Finally, add the drained rice and sauté for another 2-3 minutes. Remove from heat and break in 1 egg. Prepare a baking dish for the oven. Grease it with lard.

Wash the peppers, remove the seeds and hollow them out, then fill the insides with the prepared mixture. Close the peppers with tomato slices. Arrange the stuffed peppers in the baking dish with the opening facing up. Mix the cooked tomatoes with water, add 1 teaspoon of sugar, and pour over the peppers so that the liquid covers them.
Cover with aluminum foil and bake at 200 degrees for 2 hours. Then remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes.

dishes.name: Shopska Dish with Vegetables and Cheese
ingredients: 1 tablespoon paprika (I also added a little hot paprika)
preparation: Clean all the listed vegetables (zucchini, onion, peppers, tomatoes, and garlic), wash them, and cut them into desired pieces and rings, then place them in a baking dish. Season with salt, pepper, add dry seasoning and paprika, and mix everything. Top with sliced meaty smoked bacon. Separately beat the eggs with yogurt and oil, then pour over the vegetables. Optionally sprinkle with chopped parsley. Place in a preheated oven at 180 degrees and bake for about twenty minutes, then remove from the oven and sprinkle crumbled cheese on top. Return to the oven and bake for another ten minutes.
Serve the finished dish warm.

dishes.name: Baked Macaroni with Cheese
preparation: Pour milk over the macaroni and leave for half an hour or more in the refrigerator. Whisk the eggs, cheese, yogurt, oil, salt, and finely chopped bacon, then mix with the milk and macaroni, pour into a lightly greased baking dish size 24, and bake in a preheated oven at 180 degrees for about 40 minutes. Towards the end, remove, grate cheese on top, and return for another 5 minutes. That's it!!!

dishes.name: Lenten Pilaf with Mushrooms
preparation: In oil, sauté the finely chopped onion, then add the carrot sliced into rounds and the mushrooms sliced into thin slices. Sauté a little more, then add the rice and fry until the rice starts to clump together.Pour in 3 cups of water, and when it boils, add one teaspoon of salt, a little dry vegetable seasoning, a little pepper, half a teaspoon of curry, half a teaspoon of ground ginger, and half a teaspoon of oregano.

dishes.name: Tender and Juicy Stewed Meat
preparation: Cut the meat into cubes, place in a pot, cover with water to submerge the meat, add lard and dry seasoning. Let the meat simmer for 2 hours on low heat.When it starts to fall apart, let all the water evaporate and brown a little.Finally, add a little ground red paprika.

dishes.name: Baked Chicken in a Bag
preparation: Season the drumsticks with salt and spices.Clean and chop the potatoes and carrots to taste, then season and place them together with the chicken in a baking bag and close it.Puncture the bag in 2-3 places and place it in a baking dish.Bake for about an hour in a preheated oven at 200 degrees.

dishes.name: Tasty Chicken Sticks with Sesame
preparation: Cut the chicken into larger strips the size of fish sticks (about 8 cm by 3 cm).

Pour the chicken with the juice of half a lemon and soy sauce. Season with dry vegetable seasoning, salt, pepper, and let it rest for 30 minutes in the refrigerator. Coat the chicken sticks in flour, then in beaten egg, and finally in sesame mixed with breadcrumbs. Fry the chicken sticks over medium heat until the meat turns a nice golden color. Optionally, you can serve with salad, rice, or potatoes.

dishes.name: Stuffed Peppers (4)
ingredients: tomato or potato for closing the peppers
preparation: In oil, sauté finely chopped onion, add ground meat and sauté, add grated carrot, sauté a little more, add salt, pepper, dry vegetable seasoning, and paprika, to taste as you like it seasoned. Stuff the peppers with the mixture, close them with tomato or potato, arrange them either in a casserole or a baking dish, pour in enough water to simmer. Cover with aluminum foil and place in the oven at 200 degrees for about 50 minutes, then remove the foil, pour with tomato sauce, and leave for another half hour. Serve warm with sour milk. Enjoy.

dishes.name: Chicken Paprikash
preparation: Place the drumsticks in a smaller pot to boil.In a larger pot where you will prepare the paprikash, pour in a little oil or lard to heat. Chop the onion and garlic and sauté until golden. Add the chopped pepper and carrot to the onion, and sauté everything together, adding a little water if necessary. Finally, add the potatoes. Pour in 500 ml of tomato sauce and 500 ml of water. When the drumsticks are cooked, remove the meat from the bones and add it to the vegetables to simmer together. When the vegetables soften after 20-30 minutes, add spices to taste. I do not make a roux, but you can if you prefer it thicker. I added salt, pepper, parsley, basil, paprika, and dry vegetable seasoning.

dishes.name: Summer Moussaka with Zucchini and Carrots
preparation: Peel the zucchinis and cut them lengthwise into thin slices. Salt and let them rest. Drain excess water.
Beat three eggs. Heat oil in a pan. Coat the zucchinis: flour - eggs - flour - eggs and fry in hot oil until golden on both sides. Remove to a paper towel to drain excess fat.
Grate the carrot, and finely chop the onion and garlic. Sauté the onion in oil, add the grated carrot, pour in 1 dl of milk, and simmer for about 10 minutes until the carrot softens.
Add garlic, salt, pepper, and finely chopped parsley, all to taste, and mix in one beaten egg. Sauté briefly and remove from heat.
In a smaller greased baking dish, layer the fried zucchini, then the carrot filling until you run out of zucchini and filling, finishing with zucchini.
Beat two eggs with 1 dl of milk and a teaspoon of vegetable seasoning and pour over the moussaka.
Bake in a preheated oven at 180°C for 20-25 minutes until nicely browned. Serve warm with tomato salad, cheese, sour milk, yogurt,...

dishes.name: Lenten Peppers Stuffed with Beans
preparation: Wash the beans and place them to cook in cold water. After 20 minutes of cooking, drain the beans and add new warm water. Add finely chopped onion and garlic, salt, and let it cook. When the beans soften but are still whole, remove from heat.

In another pot, sauté the remaining finely chopped onion in hot oil and add spicy red paprika. Pour in the drained beans, add pepper, dry vegetable seasoning, and sauté a little more.Wash the dried red peppers and place them in hot water to soften. Stuff them with beans and arrange them in a pot, closing them with potatoes. If you have leftover beans, distribute them between the peppers. Pour in the water you cooked the beans in, just enough to cover them. Bake in the oven until about half of the water evaporates. Make a roux from oil and spicy red paprika, pour it over the peppers, and bake in the oven.

dishes.name: Chicken with Mlinci
preparation: In a suitable pot, pour a little oil, add butter, and place it on low heat to melt the butter. Add chicken cut into cubes, sprinkle with dry vegetable seasoning and pepper to taste, stir and fry until the meat is browned. Remove the fried meat with a slotted spoon to a plate and leave it on the stove.

In the pot where the meat was fried, pour in the cooking cream and sour cream. Briefly bring to a boil while scraping off any remnants stuck from frying the meat with a wooden spoon. Season to taste and turn off the heat.

Dissolve the chicken broth cube in 1 l of hot water. Break the mlinci into larger pieces and add them to the water. Stir, leave them for about two minutes, and remove them with a slotted spoon to a plate.

Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. Grease a deeper dish that will go in the oven (my dish was 24cm in size) with butter and arrange a third of the mlinci. Spread half of the fried chicken over them, then pour a third of the cream sauce over it. Again, layer the mlinci, place the second half of the meat, and pour the second third of the cream sauce over it. Finally, add the remaining mlinci, pour the rest of the cream over it, and evenly sprinkle with coarsely grated cheese. Bake until the surface of the dish turns a nice golden color.
Let the mlinci with chicken cool down, cut them into cubes, and serve (they cut very nicely, but we couldn't wait for them to cool down, so I cut them while hot).
Mlinci can be prepared with both chicken and turkey breast. They are tasty warm and cold...

dishes.name: Lenten Soy Goulash with Vegetables
preparation: Soak the soy steaks in lukewarm water for 60 minutes, and when they swell, drain them well and cut them into cubes.

In heated oil, sauté the chopped onion and garlic. Add the cleaned and washed bell pepper, carrot, and zucchini cut into cubes. Then add the sweet paprika and cumin and sauté everything a little. Pour in the soup, season with salt and pepper, cover, and simmer for about ten minutes over medium heat. Then add the cubed soy steaks, pour in a little more water, and continue cooking for another 10 minutes. Before serving, sprinkle the goulash with chopped parsley. Optionally serve with potatoes or pasta.

dishes.name: Baked Pork Neck with Beer
preparation: Generously grease a large baking tray (40x30 cm) with softened pork lard and set it aside. Clean the onions and cut them into wedges, spreading them over the bottom of the tray. Place the cleaned garlic cloves and rosemary sprigs on top. Season the pork neck with salt and ground pepper to taste on both sides, then take each piece of meat and rub the spices in well with your hands (the meat slices should be about 1 cm thick). Then, arrange the meat over the onions. Sprinkle very lightly with thyme. Drizzle each layer of meat with a little melted lard and pour the beer on the side. Cover the tray well with aluminum foil and bake in a preheated oven at 200 degrees for three hours.

Then remove the tray, carefully remove the aluminum foil, and transfer the meat to a suitable dish (carefully transfer the meat using two forks, as it is so tender that it may fall apart). In a bowl, take a little of the liquid and dissolve the cornstarch, then pour it into the tray. Add the honey, stir, and mash the onions with a fork to create a sauce. Return the meat, but now the side that was facing the onions should be turned up, and return the tray to the oven to brown the meat.
The meat is so tender that you won't even need a fork, and without hesitation, dip bread into the sauce directly from the tray, as it is delicious...

dishes.name: Tuna Meatballs
ingredients: 1 can of tuna chunks (drained from liquid)
preparation: Mix the tuna, potatoes, salt, pepper, dry seasoning, ground red pepper, and egg until combined. Place in the refrigerator for half an hour, then form small meatballs.Roll them in breadcrumbs, then in beaten egg, and again in breadcrumbs, and fry in hot oil until browned on all sides.Note: Add enough oil so that they do not touch the bottom of the pot.

dishes.name: Oven-Baked Pork Chops
preparation: Cover the chops with cling film and pound them with a meat mallet. Season both sides of the chops with salt, pepper, and dry vegetable seasoning, then arrange them in an oiled baking dish. On each chop, spread 1 tablespoon of cooking cream, cover with a slice of toast cheese, add a teaspoon of sour cream, sprinkle with sweet paprika, and distribute small pieces of margarine. Bake in a well-heated oven at 200 degrees for about 40 minutes.
Remove the baked chops from the oven and let them cool before serving.

dishes.name: Sautéed Potatoes with Bacon and Sausages
preparation: Peel the potatoes and cut them into cubes. Place them in a deeper pot, cover with cold water, sprinkle with one teaspoon of salt, and bring to a boil. Cut the bacon into thinner strips (I cut the bacon into 0.5 cm thick and 4 cm long) and place it in a deeper non-stick pan without adding fat. Turn on medium heat, and as soon as the bacon starts to fry, reduce the heat and fry until crispy. Remove the fried bacon with a slotted spoon onto a plate.

In the fat released by the bacon, add about 50 ml of oil and add finely chopped red onion. Fry over medium heat. When the onion softens, add the chopped garlic and fry until it softens. Then sprinkle with paprika and ground pepper and stir. Add the drained boiled potatoes and mix with a fork while pressing until mashed. Season with a teaspoon of salt (or to taste) and mix for about another minute. Finally, add finely chopped parsley and mix well.

Place the sautéed potatoes on a plate (these ingredients are for three hearty servings), sprinkle with crispy bacon, and serve with fried sausage on the side. Sautéed potatoes are excellent with minced schnitzels...
A simple dish that smells of past times...

dishes.name: Chicken with Couscous and Dried Apricots
preparation: Cut the chicken into small cubes, grate a little fresh ginger. Finely chop the dried apricots.
In olive oil, sauté the finely chopped onion in a deeper pan. Add the chicken and sauté for about 8-10 minutes, then add the grated ginger and sauté the chicken for another two minutes.
Wash and drain the sweet corn. Add the drained sweet corn, dried apricots, uncooked couscous, and season to the pan with chicken.

In a separate pot, bring 300 ml of water to a boil. Pour the boiling water over everything and stir. Cover the pan with a lid, leave it on the stove for one minute, then remove it from the heat and leave it covered for another five minutes. Before serving, stir the finished dish with a fork.

dishes.name: Sausages with Mushrooms in Tomato Sauce
preparation: In a little oil, sauté the sausages cut into slices. When they are almost fried, remove them and in the same oil sauté the chopped onion and cleaned chopped mushrooms. Season with salt and pepper and let them simmer. Stir occasionally to prevent burning. When the liquid has evaporated, add flour and chopped garlic, return the sausages, and pour in the pureed tomatoes. Stir, add spices, and let everything simmer for another twenty minutes.Serve with cooked tagliatelle or a side dish of your choice.Enjoy!

dishes.name: Baked Chicken with Vegetables
preparation: For this dish, I used a deeper pot with a non-stick bottom, 26 cm in size. Clean the onion and potatoes and cut them into 0.5 cm thick rounds. Cut the tomatoes to the same thickness. Clean the garlic and just cut it in half. Wash the mushrooms. Separate the chicken meat into thighs and drumsticks and season with chicken seasoning to taste.
Preheat the oven to 200 degrees. In the pot, first arrange the onion rings in a circle.
Layer the potatoes over the onions.
Then place the tomatoes and garlic over the potatoes.
On top, arrange the seasoned chicken. Distribute the mushrooms in between. Place the lard over the meat.

For the sauce: In a suitable bowl, pour in 500 ml of warm water, add paprika, pepper, salt, dry vegetable seasoning, and flour. Whisk everything together to avoid lumps from the flour. Pour over the prepared dish. Cover the pot with aluminum foil and press it down well. Poke the foil in two places with a toothpick and place the dish in the oven to bake for one hour.
Then, carefully remove the aluminum foil and return it to the oven to brown the meat.
Very simple, yet so delicious...

dishes.name: Potato Gnocchi
preparation: Wash the potatoes well and boil them in their skins. They should not be overcooked and falling apart, but should remain firm yet cooked.While still hot, peel them with a knife (the skin comes off easily). When they cool slightly, mash them so that no lumps remain, or better yet, grate them on the fine side of a grater.
To the grated (or mashed) potatoes, add the egg, a teaspoon of salt, and combine, then gradually add flour and knead. The mixture will stick to the surface, so add more flour as needed.

Take pieces of the dough and roll them on the table to form sausage shapes about 2 cm wide. Using a floured knife, cut pieces about 2 cm long. Press each piece onto a fork, then roll it to form the gnocchi shape. Repeat the process until all the dough is used, making sure to place the gnocchi on a floured surface to prevent sticking. Sprinkle them with a little flour and shake off the excess flour.

In a pot, pour water and add one tablespoon of salt. When it boils, add the gnocchi and wait for them to float to the surface. Once they float, cook for another half a minute and remove with a slotted spoon. I do not put more than ten pieces at a time to prevent them from sticking while cooking.Serve the finished gnocchi with sauce of your choice.

dishes.name: Lenten Sauerkraut with Rice
preparation: Cut the cabbage into larger or smaller pieces as you like and place it in a deeper pot.Add 1 cup of cabbage juice and about 3 cups of water to cover the cabbage, add 50 ml of oil, and bring to a boil over medium heat.When the cabbage softens, add the washed rice, season, and cook until the rice is also cooked.In a shallow dish/pan, pour the remaining oil, heat it, then add the smoked paprika, sauté briefly, and add it to the cabbage, leaving it on the stove to boil, then remove it.When serving, additionally season with hot ground pepper if you like!!

dishes.name: Chicken with Spinach Sauce
preparation: Separate the chicken meat into thighs and drumsticks. Season with chicken seasoning to taste on both sides. Rub each piece of meat well with your hand over the sprinkled seasoning. In a deeper non-stick pan (I used a 24 cm pan), pour in only three tablespoons of oil, as the chicken will release its fat. Place the meat in the heated oil and cover the pan. Fry the meat on low heat (for me, that is 5 out of 9, which is the highest). When it gets a nice golden color, turn the meat to the other side and continue frying, covered. The meat will take a little longer to fry, but it's worth it; it gets a beautiful crispy crust. Remove the fried meat to a plate.

Spinach sauce: In the fat where the meat was fried, pour in hot water and, using a wooden spoon, scrape off all the remnants from frying the meat (continue to work on low heat). Add the spinach blocks and stir until they thaw. Once the spinach has thawed, add the cooking cream, garlic powder, ground pepper, and chili (omit the chili if you don't like it spicy). Stir, cover, and let the sauce come to a boil. Then add the grated cheese, stir, cover, and let the sauce thicken for 3-4 minutes. During that time, stir the sauce twice. Taste to see if any more seasoning is needed and remove from heat.
Serve the fried chicken with mashed potatoes, spinach sauce, and salad to taste.
The wonderfully crispy chicken pairs perfectly with the creamy spinach sauce...

dishes.name: Stuffed Zucchini Baked in the Oven
ingredients: 3 tablespoons chopped parsley and celery leaves
preparation: Peel the zucchinis, wash them, cut them in half, and scoop out the insides, finely chopping them. Cut the meat into small cubes. In a pan, pour in the oil, add the chopped onion, add the rice, and gradually add water, cooking until it is half cooked, then add the meat and the chopped zucchini insides and sauté for a few minutes.Grease a baking dish with oil, arrange the zucchini boats, and fill them to the top, then bake for 20 minutes. Meanwhile, mix the topping of flour, sour cream, cheese, garlic, parsley, and water, and pour it over the zucchinis, baking for another 10 minutes.

dishes.name: Macaroni with Potatoes
preparation: Peel the potatoes and cut them into rounds, then boil them in salted water.At the same time, cook the macaroni in salted water.Chop the onion finely and sauté it in a little oil.Remove the sautéed onion from the heat and add the paprika.Mix the boiled potatoes and sautéed onion, then add the cooked macaroni, mix well, and season with salt and pepper for a delicious meal. Enjoy.

dishes.name: Potato and Spinach Moussaka
preparation: Peel the potatoes and cut them into thin rounds, then partially cook them in salted water.
Towards the end of cooking, add the nettles to the potatoes and strain after 5 minutes.
In a greased baking dish, pour in the potatoes mixed with nettles.
Melt one tablespoon of butter, add oil, and sauté the flour. Gradually pour in the hot milk while constantly stirring. Add pepper and salt to taste and cook until the sauce thickens.
Pour the béchamel sauce over the potatoes and mix.
In another bowl, whisk the neutral cream with cream cheese and season to taste. Pour the cream over the potatoes and sprinkle with grated cheese. Bake in the oven for about 40 minutes at 200 degrees.

dishes.name: Potato, Cheese, and Dried Meat Moussaka
preparation: Peel, wash, and boil the potatoes in salted water for 10 to 15 minutes until half cooked, strain, and cut into rounds as for moussaka.
Cut the dried meat into small cubes and place it in a bowl, add the cottage cheese and half a cup of sour cream, and mix everything together.
Grease a baking dish with butter, layer the sliced potatoes.
Spread the mixture of dried meat, sour cream, and cheese over the potatoes.
Layer the remaining potatoes on top and lightly grease with butter. Cover with foil and bake for about 25 minutes at 220°C.
Towards the end of baking, whisk the two eggs, add the remaining sour cream, season with pepper and salt, and pour over the potatoes.
Return the moussaka to the oven to brown for another five minutes. The moussaka is done when it gets a nice golden yellow color. Serve the moussaka with a salad of your choice.

dishes.name: Homemade Chicken Medallions (Chicken Nuggets)
preparation: Cut the chicken breast into slices. Season the slices with salt, add pepper, dry vegetable seasoning, and garlic granules, rub with your hand, then turn to the other side and season it as well. Then chop them in a food processor.
Form a ball and transfer it to a baking dish with a little oil.
Cover with cling film, flatten with your hand, and shape into a rectangle. Using a wet knife, cut into 12 pieces (you can also cut them smaller to get 16 pieces).
Roll the prepared medallions in flour, then in beaten eggs, and finally in breadcrumbs. Fry in heated oil until browned on both sides.
Place on kitchen paper to drain excess fat.
Serve with fries or a side dish of your choice.

dishes.name: Pork Bajadera
ingredients: 2 kg pork belly (pork loin, pork belly, or pork belly)
preparation: Place the piece of meat on a cutting board and with a sharp knife or scalpel, make 3-4 cuts in the skin and fat underneath. Place the marinade ingredients in a suitable bowl and mix well. Transfer the meat to a container that will go in the refrigerator and brush it well with the marinade on all sides using a silicone brush. Leave the remaining marinade at room temperature, as we will need it the next day for two more brushings of the meat and for the sauce. Cover the container with cling film (or if it has a lid, cover it) and leave it overnight in the refrigerator.

The next day, take the meat out of the refrigerator to sit at room temperature for half an hour before baking. Preheat the oven to 180 degrees. Place the meat on the oven rack (the rack does not heat up), brush it with marinade again, but only on the side where the skin is. Lightly cover it with aluminum foil, do not close it completely, just drape the foil over the meat. Place a baking tray with a little water under the rack to collect the juices from the baking and bake for 40 minutes. After 40 minutes, remove the foil and continue baking for another hour.

Then, brush the meat with marinade again, increase the temperature to 200 degrees, and bake for another 10-15 minutes. Carefully remove the baked meat with gloves, along with the rack (I placed another tray under the rack to be able to transfer it) and let it cool so that we can cut it nicely.

For the sauce from the remaining marinade: Add three tablespoons of the meat's baking juice and three tablespoons of water to the remaining marinade. Place over low heat and cook until it thickens slightly. Cool and serve with the meat.
Preparing the meat for pork bajadera is not complicated, it takes a little more time, but your effort will be rewarded with the juiciest bites that melt in your mouth.

dishes.name: Beetroot Patties
preparation: In a food processor, combine the beetroot, zucchini, onion, garlic, chickpeas, cashews, sweet paprika, smoked paprika, mustard, salt, pepper, and oatmeal, and form patties. Arrange them in a baking dish lined with parchment paper. Bake for about twenty minutes at 180 degrees.You can spray them with oil before baking.Enjoy!

dishes.name: Quinoa Risotto with Mushrooms
ingredients: 2 heaping tablespoons sautéed onion from a bag
preparation: Sauté the bell pepper and carrot in a little oil. When they soften, add the mushrooms and sauté. Towards the end of sautéing, add the sautéed onion from the bag, and sauté for another minute. Remove from heat, then add the quinoa, parsley, and seasonings to taste. Enjoy!!!

dishes.name: Chicken with Dried Cherries and Couscous
preparation: Cut the chicken breast into strips of 5*1cm. For the marinade, mix the lemon juice and grated zest with crushed cumin, cinnamon, grated nutmeg, sweet red paprika, and salt.
Pour the marinade over the cut chicken and let it rest for an hour in the refrigerator.

In a separate pot, bring 250 ml of water to a boil. Place the couscous in another pot and pour boiling water over it, add olive oil, dried cherries, grated almonds, season with salt, and stir. Let it sit covered until the couscous absorbs the water. Once the couscous cools, serve it on a plate.

Fry the chicken in hot oil. Towards the end, add finely chopped onion and crushed garlic. Continue frying the chicken for another 2-3 minutes. Optionally, serve the chicken with couscous, rice, or potatoes.

dishes.name: Potatoes with Roasted Peppers and Cheese
ingredients: 5 roasted peppers (can be from the freezer)
preparation: Wash the potatoes well and boil them until half cooked. Once cooked, cool them, peel, and cut into rounds. Grease the bottom of a baking dish with oil, arrange half of the potato rounds, season with salt and pepper, then layer four roasted peppers that have been cleaned of stems and seeds on top. Drizzle with a little oil, place half of the grated cheese on top, then layer the remaining potato rounds and the fifth pepper cut into pieces. Season with salt and pepper, drizzle with a little oil, and bake in an oven preheated to 180 degrees for about 15 minutes, then remove and grate the remaining cheese on top. Return to the oven and bake for another ten minutes. Serve the dish warm.

dishes.name: Peas with Vegetables and Chicken
ingredients: 3 teaspoons dry vegetable seasoning (or to taste)
preparation: Season the chicken thighs (I cut them in half) with chicken seasoning to taste on both sides. In the pot where you will prepare the dish, pour in oil and heat it. Once the oil is hot, add the meat and fry until it gets a nice golden color. Remove the fried meat to a plate and leave it on the stove.

In the fat where the meat was fried, add finely chopped onion, diced celery root, parsnip, and carrot cut into half-moons. Sauté in a covered pot over medium heat, stirring occasionally, for about 10 minutes. Use a wooden spoon to scrape off any bits stuck to the bottom of the pot from frying the meat, then add the sweet corn, diced potatoes, and finely chopped garlic. Stir, then sprinkle with dry vegetable seasoning, ground pepper, sweet paprika, and ground ginger. Mix everything well and continue to sauté for another 10 minutes.

In 400 ml of boiling water, dissolve the tomato puree and pour it over the vegetables. Cook on low heat in a partially covered pot until the soup thickens slightly and the vegetables soften. Towards the end, add the chopped pepper (I like it when the pepper remains crunchy, so I add it towards the end of cooking), stir, then return the fried meat. Simmer the dish for another five minutes, sprinkle with finely chopped parsley, and remove from heat.
A very tasty lunch, try it and you'll see for yourself...

dishes.name: Stuffed Leg Roasted in the Oven
ingredients: about 3 kg pork leg in one piece
preparation: Make incisions in the leg with a knife in as many places as possible and as deep as possible, then coat it with mustard. Rub in salt and sprinkle with pepper. In each cut, place chopped garlic and a piece of cut dry bacon. Cover the prepared leg with foil and let it sit for at least 3-4 hours, or overnight. In the baking tray where you will roast the leg, place 2-3 beech wood planks and lay the leg on top. Coat the entire leg well with lard, pour 2 glasses of water into the tray, cover with foil, and place it in an oven preheated to 220 degrees. After 15 minutes, reduce the temperature to 180 degrees and continue roasting for at least 90 minutes. If necessary, add a glass of water to the tray to prevent burning. During roasting, spoon the liquid (juices) from the tray over the leg. After 90 minutes of roasting, remove the foil and roast until browned on top, continuously spooning the liquid from the tray over the leg. Check if the leg is done by piercing it deeply with a knife; if no blood comes out, it means it is cooked. Enjoy!

dishes.name: Lenten Sarma (in Oil)
preparation: Prepare the leaves; if they are large, cut them in half. Wash the rice, finely chop the onion, sauté in a little oil, add grated carrot, then add the washed rice, a tablespoon of dry vegetable seasoning, a little pepper, and a teaspoon of sweet paprika. You can also add a few tablespoons of ground walnuts, but it is tasty even without them. Place one tablespoon of this mixture in the center of each leaf and roll it into a sarma, arranging them in a medium pot.

Press the arranged sarma with a small plate and pour in just enough water to cook. Add a few bay leaves around. Cook for two to three hours, or a little longer for the lenten version than for the meaty one. Add water during cooking as needed. Towards the end of cooking, make a roux. In a little oil, add two tablespoons of flour and sweet paprika, pour over the sarma, and add a little more water, letting it simmer a bit longer.

dishes.name: Zucchini with Oregano
preparation: First, clean the zucchini and cut it into thin rounds. Salt and let it sit in a colander for about 15 minutes. Then sprinkle with oregano.In three different bowls, arrange the eggs, flour, and breadcrumbs. Dip each zucchini round in flour, then in beaten egg with a little seasoning, and finally in breadcrumbs, and fry. After a few minutes, turn each piece to cook evenly on both sides. Once done, place them on a paper towel to drain excess oil. Enjoy!

dishes.name: Burgers with Red Beans
ingredients: 1 can of red beans (net weight 420 g)
preparation: In a small pot, place the ground flaxseed, add 6 tablespoons of cold water, stir, and set aside while preparing the other ingredients. Place the oats and sunflower seeds in a food processor and grind them to a flour-like consistency. In the food processor (or a strong blender), add all the other ingredients (red beans, onion, garlic, olive oil, soy sauce, soaked flaxseed along with the water it didn't absorb, and 50 ml of cold water). Also, add the spices. Rinse the red beans well under cold water before adding. Blend everything well to combine. Transfer the mixture to a suitable bowl, add finely chopped parsley, and mix. Add breadcrumbs until you get a mixture that can be shaped into patties. The mixture should still be slightly sticky. When shaping the patties, sprinkle a little flour on the work surface, and flour your hands. Use a wet spoon (dip the spoon in cold water before each scoop) to take some mixture, place it in the palm of one hand, shape it into a circle, and gently press it to form a patty about 1 cm thick. Always do this with floured hands.
Place aluminum foil in a suitable dish and arrange the formed patties on top (I made 9 patties). Leave the patties in the refrigerator for one hour.

In a non-stick skillet, pour in oil to a height of 1 cm and heat it over medium heat. Once the oil is hot, add the patties and fry until golden brown on both sides. Remove the fried patties to a kitchen towel to absorb excess oil. You can also fry the patties on a grill pan, or arrange them in a baking dish lined with parchment paper, which has been greased with oil, brush the patties with oil, and bake at 200 degrees until golden brown.
Serve these wonderful patties with a side of your choice.
I made pumpkin flatbreads and crispy potatoes, and we ate them as sandwiches. I will post the recipe for the flatbreads and potatoes in the coming days...

dishes.name: Pasta in Pumpkin Sauce
preparation: First, make the pumpkin puree. Peel the pumpkin, cut it into cubes, and place it in a suitable pot. Cover it with cold water and bring it to a boil. Once the pumpkin is soft, drain it and mash it with a fork to get a puree. Set the prepared pumpkin aside.

In a larger, deeper non-stick skillet, melt the butter and add finely chopped onion and garlic. Sauté the onion over medium heat, stirring, until it softens. Add the pumpkin puree, chicken broth (or dissolve one chicken bouillon cube in 200 ml of hot water), cooking cream, and sour cream. Mix everything well. Season with nutmeg, pepper, and salt to taste. Cook on low heat for 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

While the sauce is cooking, cook the pasta according to the package instructions. I used spaghetti, but you can use any pasta of your choice. Once the pasta is cooked, add it to the sauce in two batches and mix well. Continue cooking the sauce with the pasta for another 3 minutes, or until the sauce thickens. Serve the pasta with pumpkin sauce on plates, sprinkle with parmesan, garnish with parsley, and serve.
Anyone who loves pumpkin will surely enjoy this wonderful taste of pasta in creamy sauce...

dishes.name: Rolled Pork
preparation: Pound the meat and sprinkle with spices to taste. Then spread the cheese spread as desired (I used Philadelphia) and layer the slices of mortadella. Roll everything up nicely and leave it in the freezer for 5 minutes.
Beat the egg with a little milk, and prepare breadcrumbs in another bowl.
Dip the schnitzels first in the egg and milk mixture, then coat in breadcrumbs.Fry in heated oil for a few minutes on both sides until they turn dark golden brown.Enjoy!

dishes.name: Chicken Stew with Peas and Potatoes
preparation: Place the chicken in a pot, add the chopped onion (it doesn't have to be finely chopped), carrots cut into rounds, peel the potatoes and cut them into larger cubes, add the peas, and pour in enough water to cover everything. Cook for an hour and a half, and when cooked, make a roux by heating oil in a pan, adding two tablespoons of flour, sweet paprika, stirring, and seasoning to taste. Let it simmer a bit.

dishes.name: Sataras (12)
preparation: Clean the onion, wash it, and finely chop it. Wash the peppers, remove the stems and seeds, and chop them into strips. Wash the tomatoes and slice them. In a pan, heat a little oil and sauté the chopped onion for about five minutes, then add the chopped peppers. When the peppers are sautéed, add the chopped tomatoes and sauté everything together for about 5-7 minutes. Beat the eggs and pour them over the dish, mixing everything well, season with salt, and serve.

dishes.name: Meatballs in Tomato Sauce with Mushrooms
preparation: Soak a slice of bread in a little milk and then drain it. In the ground meat, add chopped onion and garlic, breadcrumbs, soaked bread, parsley, spices, and the beaten egg. Mix the meat well and form meatballs, coat them in flour, and fry in hot oil until nicely browned.Remove the fried meatballs to a plate. Finely chop the mushrooms. Heat oil in a pot, add the chopped mushrooms, chopped garlic, and sauté until the mushrooms release their liquid.
Pour in the tomatoes and simmer briefly.
Add the fried meatballs to the tomato sauce. Cook everything together for about 10 minutes until the sauce thickens nicely. Season to taste. Serve the meatballs with cooked pasta and mashed potatoes.

dishes.name: Breaded Burgers with Cheese
preparation: In the ground meat, add finely chopped onion, finely chopped garlic, salt, pepper, sweet paprika, oregano, and the egg, and mix everything well.
Flatten the meat on foil into a rectangle about 1 cm thick. Spread grated cheese over the meat. Roll it tightly and place it in the freezer for half an hour to firm up for easier slicing.
Prepare flour and breadcrumbs for breading, and beat the eggs with milk.
Cut the meat roll into pieces about 1.5 cm thick.

Coat each piece of the roll in flour, then in the egg and milk mixture, and finally in breadcrumbs, and fry in hot oil until nicely browned on both sides. Remove the fried breaded burgers to a paper towel to drain excess oil.

dishes.name: Chicken Fillets in Ajvar Sauce with Mushrooms
preparation: Cut the chicken into fillets, season with salt and pepper to taste. Finely chop the onion and garlic.
In heated oil, sauté the chicken fillets, remove them, and wrap them in foil.
In the same oil, sauté the chopped onion and garlic, then add the sliced mushrooms. Add dry vegetable seasoning, pepper, salt, and sauté until the excess water released by the mushrooms evaporates.
Then add the tomato sauce, ajvar, and water, mix everything, and season with spices. Cook the sauce for a few more minutes until you reach the desired thickness.
Finally, return the chicken to the sauce, add finely chopped walnuts and parsley, and briefly sauté everything together. Serve the chicken with potatoes and salad if desired.

dishes.name: Quick Caesar Pasta with Fish Sticks
preparation: Cook the pasta in salted water, rinse with cold water, and drain.

Let the fish sticks thaw, then cut them into pieces and sauté them in heated oil along with finely chopped garlic. In a bowl with pasta, add the sautéed fish sticks and garlic. Then grate cheese into the bowl and gently mix.
For the sauce, add lemon juice to the sour cream, season with salt and pepper. Serve the pasta on a plate and drizzle with the sauce. Optionally, serve the pasta with cherry tomatoes.

dishes.name: Pork Chops in Tomato and Rosemary Sauce
preparation: Pound the chops with a meat mallet, season with salt and spices.
Coat the chops in flour.
Fry the chops in heated oil until browned on both sides, then remove and wrap in foil.

In the same skillet, briefly sauté finely chopped garlic. Pour in the tomato puree and water, add chopped rosemary, and return the chops. If necessary, add a cup of water, and simmer until the chops are tender. Finally, add chopped fresh parsley. Serve the chops with potatoes and salad if desired.

dishes.name: Chicken in Tomato and Olive Sauce
preparation: Cut the chicken breast into fillets, season with salt and pepper (you can also cut the chicken into cubes).
In a little hot oil in a pot, brown the chicken until golden. Place the cooked meat on absorbent paper.
In the same oil, sauté chopped onion and garlic until golden.
Then add the diced tomatoes, tomato juice, and chopped olives. Once everything starts to boil, cook for about 10 minutes.
Add pepper and salt to taste, return the browned chicken to the tomato sauce. Finally, sprinkle with chopped rosemary. Optionally, serve the chicken with rice or potatoes.

dishes.name: Duck Stew
preparation: Remove the skin from the duck and debone it.After deboning, I got 150 g of pure meat and 250 g of bones and skin.
Cut the pure meat into strips.Place the bones and skin in a deeper pot and cover with 500 ml of water (to submerge).
Bring to a boil over low heat, skimming off the foam as it cooks.
Cook for about 30 minutes, then remove the skin and bones from the broth, leaving the broth aside for pouring over the duck during stewing.
While the broth is cooking, prepare the vegetables.Peel and finely chop the onion.
Peel the carrot and cut it into rounds.Peel the celery, cut it into strips, then into small cubes.
Cut the quince into slices and then into small cubes.
In a pot, heat a little olive oil, and when hot, add the chopped onion to sauté briefly over low heat.
Add the carrot, celery, and quince, and sauté for about 15 minutes.
Season the duck meat strips with salt and add them to the sautéed vegetables, along with the crushed garlic, and fry for about 10 minutes until the meat changes color.
Add the red wine and simmer over low heat until the wine evaporates.Then add the broth, pesto, chopped tomato sauce, and bay leaf, and stew for another 30 minutes.
During stewing, if necessary or if you prefer it to be juicier, add broth as desired.Serve the stewed duck with boiled or roasted potato gnocchi or cooked pasta.

dishes.name: Easy and Quick Lunch
preparation: Sauté onion, garlic, potatoes cut into cubes, carrot, and celery in oil. Briefly fry and add chopped tomatoes and 200 ml of water.Cook until the vegetables soften, add the chopped zucchini, and add more water and cook. Then add salt, pepper, seasoning, and parsley. Finally, add the beaten egg with flour and sour cream. Cook a little longer and serve alone or with some meat.

dishes.name: Stuffed Schnitzel
preparation: Cover the schnitzels with cling film and pound them with a kitchen mallet. Season to taste, spread with kaymak, layer with thinly sliced dry neck, then cheese, and roll up. Coat the prepared rolls in flour, then in beaten eggs, and finally in breadcrumbs. Fry in heated oil until browned on both sides. Place on kitchen paper to drain excess fat and serve.

dishes.name: Hake with Peppers and Tomatoes
preparation: Cut the hake fillets in half and arrange them in a baking dish. Pour the juice of half a lemon over them and sprinkle with chopped garlic. Bake the hake for 5 minutes in a preheated oven at 200°C. Remove the baked hake from the baking dish.
In a pan, sauté the onion in oil, then add the tomatoes cut into larger cubes, diced peppers, chopped mushrooms, oregano, and pepper.
In the baking dish, layer half of the hake and place the sautéed peppers and tomatoes with mushrooms on top.
Layer the remaining pieces of hake over the peppers and tomatoes.
Sprinkle the hake with grated cheese.
Bake everything in a preheated oven at 200°C for about 10-15 minutes. Serve the hake with rice or potatoes if desired.

dishes.name: Fusilli with Bacon, Cheese, and Cream
ingredients: to taste and as needed pepper, oregano, and salt
preparation: In a little oil, sauté finely chopped bacon and ham. You can use only bacon or only ham.
Then add the fusilli and mix.
Add the cheese, mix until the cheese melts.
Finally, stir in the cream, season with pepper and salt if needed. Sprinkle with a little oregano, mix gently, and serve with a salad of your choice.

dishes.name: Pilaf with Chickpeas and Chicken
preparation: Soak the raw chickpeas in cold water overnight. The next day, drain, rinse, and add fresh water. Cook the chickpeas; they will double in size during cooking. Cook the chickpeas for about 30 minutes, then drain. Soak the rice for an hour before cooking.
Cut the chicken into smaller cubes. Cut the onion into quarters, then slice it into rings. Cut the carrots into smaller strips.

In heated oil, fry the meat, then add the spices (pepper, salt, and cumin). Sauté until it starts to turn golden on all sides, then add the onion. Sauté the onion with the meat until the onion softens.
Add the carrots on top, but do not mix. Pour in 250 ml of water. Cook for about 15 minutes over medium heat. Add the chickpeas and dried grapes. Cook for another 15 minutes.
Finally, add the drained rice. Place it over all the ingredients. Add salt to taste. Cover and cook on low heat for 20 minutes. Optionally, add finely chopped parsley.

dishes.name: Pork Chops in Mustard and Ketchup Sauce
preparation: Dredge each chop in flour and fry in oil until browned on both sides.

Add warm water to the fried chops to cover them. Add the ketchup. The recipe calls for 200 ml of ketchup; I used less, spraying the chops with ketchup from the bottle 3-4 times. Simmer for 60 minutes, adding warm water as needed.
Towards the end, add minced garlic and parsley. I didn't have fresh, so I used dried parsley.
I also added a little salt towards the end; taste and adjust to your liking.
I served the chops with sautéed potato slices.

dishes.name: The Most Beautiful Rolled Chicken in Bacon
preparation: Cut the chicken breast into chops. Season the chops with salt and pepper, and pound them with a meat mallet. Cut the dried meat and cheese into thin slices, and the smoked bacon into strips. Place a piece of dried meat and a piece of cheese on each chop, then roll it up. Wrap each package in a strip of bacon and secure with a toothpick. Arrange the rolled chicken in a baking dish lined with parchment paper. Brush the chicken with a little oil. Bake in a preheated oven at 220°C for about 50 minutes, covered with foil, and uncover towards the end to allow it to brown nicely. Serve the chicken with potatoes if desired.

dishes.name: Chicken with Vegetables (7)
preparation: In a pan with oil, sauté finely chopped onion, add chicken cut into cubes and one soup cube.
When sautéed, add the vegetables and pour in about 200 ml of water. Let it simmer.
Finally, season and pour in the cream that you previously mixed with flour. Simmer for a few more minutes and serve.

dishes.name: Juicy Chicken Covered with Mushrooms
preparation: Cut the chicken into chops. Mix the chicken with spices and oil. Let the chicken rest for about 45 minutes in the fridge.
In another pot, sauté the chicken on both sides until it gets a nice golden color.
Arrange the chicken in a greased baking dish.
In a little oil, sauté finely chopped onion and garlic, then add diced peppers and sauté briefly. Add sliced mushrooms. Sauté until the water released by the mushrooms evaporates.
Pour in the cooking cream and add one tablespoon of flour, season, and mix well. Let the sauce thicken and remove from heat.
Place two tablespoons of mushroom sauce over each piece of meat, then sprinkle with grated cheese.
Put in the oven to bake at 200°C for about 20 minutes. Serve the finished chicken with pilaf or potatoes.

dishes.name: Fried Eggplant Slices
preparation: Wash the eggplant, dry it, and peel it. Cut off the thicker part from the top with a sharp knife, leaving the thinner part with the stem. Cut the eggplant lengthwise, but not all the way to the stem. Then cut it in half lengthwise.Salt the water, and when it starts to boil, add the eggplant slices to cook for about ten minutes on low heat.Remove them and let them cool.In one bowl, mix flour, breadcrumbs, salt, pepper, and paprika, and in another, beat the eggs with mustard, spices, and paprika.Coat the eggplant pieces well in the dry mixture, press with your fingers, then dip in the egg mixture to coat well, and fry in well-heated oil.Turn them every minute or two until they are nicely browned. Place on a warm plate covered with a paper towel to absorb excess fat.

dishes.name: Oven-Baked Chicken and Vegetables
preparation: Separate the thighs from the drumsticks, place them in a suitable dish, add the wings, salt, pepper, and mix. In a pan, heat the lard, then fry the thighs, drumsticks, and wings on both sides and set aside on a plate. In the same fat, sauté finely chopped green onion and chopped carrot. Add peeled and chopped tomatoes, chopped pepper, finely chopped potatoes, salt, pepper, dry seasoning, pour in water, and sauté for about ten minutes, then transfer to a greased baking dish with homemade lard. Distribute the meat over the vegetables, cover with aluminum foil, and bake at 200 degrees for 30 minutes.
Then remove the foil and bake at 180 degrees for 20 minutes. Remove the baked dish from the oven, let it cool slightly, and serve.

dishes.name: Lentil Patties (Vegan)
preparation: Rinse the red lentils well under cold water and place them in a deeper bowl. Pour the lentils with 300 ml of hot water, stir, and let them sit until the lentils swell and absorb almost all the water (I soaked them overnight). Then drain the lentils (since a little water remains), place them in a food processor, and grind them. Transfer the prepared lentils to a deeper bowl and set aside.

Finely chop the onion and garlic, grate the carrot on the small side of the grater, cut the cabbage into thin short strips, and dice the pepper. Heat oil in a deeper non-stick pan. Add the chopped onion to the heated oil and sauté over medium heat until it softens slightly. Then add the garlic, carrot, cabbage, and pepper, and continue frying until the vegetables soften. Add all the spices and mix well. Remove from heat and let cool.

Transfer the cooled vegetables with spices to the bowl with lentils, add breadcrumbs, and mix all the ingredients well by hand (taste to see if you need to add more spices). On a work surface, sprinkle a little flour to dust your hands when shaping the patties. Take a full tablespoon of the mixture, first shape it into a ball, then press it to form a patty about 1 cm thick (don't be confused, the mixture is still a bit sticky...). Arrange the formed patties on a suitable dish lined with aluminum foil. Let the patties rest in the fridge for half an hour before frying. I got 12 patties from this mixture.

In a deeper non-stick pan, pour in oil to a height of 1 cm and heat it over medium heat (for me, this was 7 on a scale of 1-9, although I reduced it to 6 when flipping them). Place the patties in the heated oil and fry until browned on both sides. Remove the fried patties to a kitchen towel to absorb excess fat. Serve with a side dish of your choice.
They are very tasty; I recommend you try them...

dishes.name: Green Beans (3)
preparation: Chop the onion, carrot, red pepper, garlic, and tomato into cubes. Sauté in a little oil. When almost done, add the ham cut into cubes.Sauté briefly, add water, and let it simmer for about ten minutes. Then add the green beans, add a little more water, and cook for 1 hour.In a pan, heat oil, add flour, and stir until the flour turns golden yellow, then add sweet paprika, dry vegetable seasoning, salt, and mix. Sauté for another minute and pour into the green beans. Mix and cook for another five minutes.

dishes.name: Vegan Beet Patties
preparation: Grind the beets, onion, chickpeas, and cashews in a food processor.Add the chopped garlic and grated zucchini.Add the spices and mix the mixture well.Finally, stir in the oatmeal.Form patties with your hands and arrange them on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper.If desired, spray the patties with oil before baking.Bake the patties for about twenty minutes at 200 degrees.Enjoy!

dishes.name: Rolled White Chicken Meat
preparation: Slice the mushrooms (not too thin), and cut the onion into wedges. In a non-stick pan, pour in a little oil and heat it. Add the chopped onion to the heated oil and sauté over medium heat until it softens slightly. Then add the mushrooms. Sprinkle with dry vegetable seasoning, ground pepper, and garlic powder, and sauté until all the water released by the mushrooms evaporates. Remove the sautéed mushrooms to cool.

Cut the white meat into chops about 0.5 cm thick. Place cling film over the meat and pound each piece to a thickness of about 2-3 mm. Spread a larger piece of cling film (or use two pieces of transparent foil) and arrange the slices of bacon in two rows (one row, then place the second row of bacon underneath. I had seven wider slices of bacon in the first row, and in the second row, I cut them in half and arranged them) slightly overlapping.
Place the prepared meat over the bacon and sprinkle with chicken seasoning to taste.
Evenly distribute the sautéed mushrooms with onions over the meat.
Peel the roasted red peppers, remove the seeds, and cut each pepper in half. Arrange the halves over the mushrooms, then coarsely grate the cheese.

Using the cling film, tightly roll everything into a roll. Then transfer the roll to aluminum foil (without the cling film) and tightly wrap and secure the ends. You can also form the roll directly on the aluminum foil, but I find it much easier to do it with cling film and then transfer it to aluminum foil. Place the roll wrapped in aluminum foil in a baking dish measuring 30 cm x 12 cm x 8 cm. Preheat the oven to 200 degrees and bake the roll for one hour.
Remove the baking dish with the roll from the oven and carefully transfer the roll to a suitable wider dish. Cut the foil and remove it, then return it to the oven to brown.
Let the chicken roll cool before slicing.
Very tasty and decorative...

dishes.name: Baked Potatoes with Bacon and Cheese
ingredients: 1 packet for baked potatoes with bacon and cheese
preparation: Cut the potatoes and bacon into smaller pieces (1x1 cm).
Sauté the bacon in a heated pan for 2 minutes.
Then add the potatoes.
Dissolve the contents of the packet in 200 ml of milk and 300 ml of water, stir, and pour over the potatoes and bacon.
When it boils, pour the mixture into a baking dish and bake in a preheated oven at 200 degrees for 35 minutes.
Sprinkle grated cheese over the dish, if desired, and bake for another 10 minutes.

dishes.name: Fried Hake (6)
preparation: Clean the fish and cut it into pieces of desired size and season with salt to taste.In one bowl, mix the flours, salt, and seasoning to taste, then coat the fish in it.Fry in plenty of oil over high heat for about 10 minutes on one side, then on the other side for the same amount of time. Place the cooked fish on a napkin to absorb excess fat.

dishes.name: Boiled Sweet Cabbage
ingredients: 1 head of fresh cabbage (cut, not necessarily finely)
preparation: In a pot, heat oil or lard, add the onion, and sauté while occasionally adding a little water. When the onion softens, add the meat, carrot, and sauté for another 5 minutes. Then add the cabbage, season, and pour in enough water to cover the cabbage. Cover and simmer on low heat for half an hour.Then make a roux and pour it into the cabbage, simmering for another 5 to 10 minutes. Enjoy!!!

dishes.name: Baked Meatballs in Pepper and Tomato Sauce
preparation: Add milk to the ground meat and mix well. Then add chopped onion and garlic, breadcrumbs, parsley, spices, and the beaten egg. Knead the meat well and form meatballs.
Roll the meatballs in flour, then fry in hot oil. Remove the meatballs and set them aside on a plate.
Roast the bell peppers in the oven, peel them, and cut them into strips. In the same oil, sauté chopped onion and garlic, then add the peppers and tomato puree.
Pour in water, and when it boils, cook for 10 minutes, then return the meatballs to the sauce. Pour in the white wine and simmer briefly.
Pour everything into a baking dish. Sprinkle with grated cheese and chopped parsley.
Bake the meatballs for about 15 minutes in a preheated oven at 180 degrees. Serve the meatballs with rice or potatoes if desired.

dishes.name: Honey Duck
ingredients: 1 teaspoon Chilita – sweet and spicy chili sauce (ready-made product)
preparation: Season the duck with salt.
In a small bowl, mix honey and chili sauce and coat the duck well on all sides with this mixture. Place the prepared duck in a baking dish with a little olive oil.
Peel, wash, and cut the potatoes into eighths, season with salt, and place around the duck.
Immediately add 50 ml of water and place the dish in the oven at 180 degrees and bake for about 90 minutes, turning the duck occasionally.
Cut the roasted duck into larger pieces and serve with a side dish and salad of your choice.

dishes.name: Meat on Vegetables
preparation: Clean, wash, and dry the meat, season with spices (salt, pepper, dry vegetable seasoning, garlic powder, and a little dried parsley) and rub the spices into the meat, then let it rest for a while. In a pot, heat 50 ml of oil, add the meat, and fry it slightly on both sides, then remove it from the pot, and in the same oil, add the onion, season, stir, and sauté for 5-10 minutes. Then add the chopped tomatoes and sauté for another 5-10 minutes. Then add the peppers; when the peppers are halfway done, place the meat in a baking dish, season to taste, and stir. Bake in a preheated oven at 200°C for 45 minutes.

dishes.name: Holiday Pork Chops in Tomato Sauce with Peppers
preparation: Season the pork chops with salt and pepper to taste, and pound them with a meat mallet.
Dredge each chop in flour and fry in hot oil until they get a nice golden color.
Remove the chops and wrap them in foil to keep warm.
In another pot, sauté finely chopped garlic in a little oil until it becomes translucent. Cut the peppers into smaller cubes and add them to the onion, sauté briefly with the onion.
Then add the tomato puree and water, and when it boils, cook for 10 minutes. Add pepper and salt to taste.
Then pour in the white wine and add the chops to the sauce. Sprinkle with finely chopped parsley and simmer for another 5 minutes. Serve the finished chops with potatoes.

dishes.name: Zucchini, Potato and Cheese Patties
preparation: Peel the zucchini and grate them coarsely. Sprinkle with 1 teaspoon of salt, mix, let them sit, and then squeeze out the excess water with your hands. Peel the potatoes, grate them coarsely, and squeeze out the excess water immediately. Finely chop the onion and garlic. Grate the cheese (I used Edam...).

In a suitable bowl, combine the grated and drained zucchini and potatoes and mix. Add the onion and garlic, mix, then add the eggs that have been lightly beaten with a fork. Mix well. Add the cheese and combine everything thoroughly. Add the breadcrumbs and mix them with the other ingredients. Add paprika and seasonings to taste and mix well.

In a non-stick skillet, pour oil to a height of 1 cm and heat it over medium heat. Use a spoon (that can always be dipped into the oil in the skillet) to scoop the mixture and drop it into the heated oil. Gently press with the spoon to form patties. Fry on both sides until nicely browned (adjust the temperature on your stove so they fry nicely without remaining raw in the middle). Remove the fried patties onto a paper towel to absorb excess fat.
The patties are very tasty. You can serve them on their own with a salad or as a side dish to fried or roasted meat.

dishes.name: Stuffed Cannelloni in Sauce
preparation: Cut the cheese into sticks the length of the cannelloni. Place on a larger slice of ham and roll them together.
Stuff the rolled ham into the cannelloni. Repeat with the remaining cannelloni. Pour tomato sauce into the bottom of a baking dish and arrange the cannelloni.
Pour cooking cream over them and sprinkle with grated cheese (150g).
Bake in a preheated oven at 210 degrees for 30-35 minutes.

dishes.name: Quick Chicken with Mushrooms in White Sauce
preparation: In a little oil, sauté the chopped onion and garlic. When it turns a nice yellow color...
... add the white meat cut into smaller cubes. Let it simmer for about 10 minutes.
Add the mushrooms cut into thicker slices. Season with vegetable seasoning, pepper, and salt, add a little water to cover, and simmer until the water evaporates.
A few minutes before the end, add the sour cream, chopped parsley, and let it come to a boil while stirring constantly for a minute. Serve the chicken with pasta or mashed potatoes as desired.

dishes.name: Bean Stew (4)
preparation: Wash the white beans, drain, and boil them twice. Then drain again. Cut the meat into cubes. Wash, peel, and chop the vegetables into cubes, then blend them along with the potato. In a pot, heat a little oil and a cube of margarine, then add the vegetables and two bay leaves and sauté for five minutes. Then add the meat and season with salt, pepper, vegetable seasoning, and dried parsley. Add the boiled and drained beans, pour in water, and cook for about three hours, stirring occasionally until the beans are cooked. Then, for the roux, heat a little oil in a skillet, add flour, and stir until it turns golden yellow, then add sweet paprika and let it boil. Pour this into the bean stew, mix, and let it simmer for another 5-6 minutes, tasting to see if more seasoning is needed.

dishes.name: Lenten Chickpeas in Red Ajvar Sauce
preparation: Soak the raw chickpeas in cold water overnight. The next day, drain, wash, and add fresh water. Cook the chickpeas, which will double in size during cooking. Cook for about 30 minutes, then drain.
Finely chop the onion and garlic and sauté in olive oil.
When the onion turns brown, add the tomato cut into smaller cubes.
Pour in the tomato sauce, season with salt, pepper, and add sugar. Let it simmer on low heat for about 10 minutes.
Add the cooked chickpeas to the tomato sauce. Sauté briefly, then add ajvar and let it come to a boil. Finally, sprinkle with chopped parsley. Serve with chicken schnitzels if desired.

dishes.name: Summer Stew
preparation: In a little oil, sauté the chopped onion for a few minutes, then add the chopped pepper and the chopped and peeled tomato, and cook (fry) everything together for about 20 minutes. Season to taste. If desired, add one or two eggs towards the end. Serve with a piece of cheese and preferably some homemade hot bread. Enjoy!!!

dishes.name: Bacon with Potatoes and White Meat
preparation: Arrange the bacon in a dish, thinly slice the potatoes or use a slicer, and cook for about 5-10 minutes. Season the potatoes. Cut the chicken fillet into cubes, add two eggs and the sour cream, season, and mix well. Once you have arranged the bacon, place a layer of cooked and seasoned potatoes, a layer of the meat mixture, then again a layer of potatoes, and a layer of the meat mixture, continuing until all ingredients are used. Cover with bacon, place foil over it, and bake at 200°C for 30 minutes, then remove the foil and bake for another 10 minutes. Enjoy.

dishes.name: Baked Potatoes with Additions
preparation: Wash, peel, and dry the potatoes with a cloth, then cut them into slightly thicker pieces. In a separate bowl, mix corn flour, polenta, dry ground pepper, and all other spices. Add the potatoes and mix well with your hands. In a baking dish, place the lard and heat it well in the oven, then remove and place the potatoes in the hot lard. Cover with foil (I used baking paper) and bake for half an hour. Then remove, stir, and return to bake without foil.

dishes.name: Marinated Turkey Breast with Rice and Vegetables
ingredients: 200 g frozen seasoned vegetable mix *4 seasons* (ready-made product)
1 tablespoon Chilita – sweet and spicy chili sauce (ready-made product)
preparation: Place the rice in a small pot with a little olive oil and pour in water to which you have added a little salt and a little Mediterranean herb mix, and cook on low heat until the water evaporates, or until the rice is cooked for about 30 minutes (depending on the type of rice).
Cut the turkey breast into cubes. Prepare the marinade.
In a small bowl, combine all the marinade ingredients, mix well, and pour over the turkey, mixing well.

Let the prepared turkey marinate for about 30 minutes. In a wok pan, heat a little olive oil, add the marinated turkey, stir in the pan, add 50 ml of water, and fry until nicely browned for about 10 minutes.
Remove the browned meat from the pan and in the same pan sauté the frozen seasoned vegetable mix *4 seasons* covered for 7 minutes.
Add the sautéed turkey to the pan with the vegetables, add the cooked rice, mix everything, and serve. I had an exceptionally tasty lunch.

dishes.name: Children's Lunch with Broccoli
preparation: Lightly pound the schnitzels and season with salt. Separate the broccoli into florets and cook. Wash the rice well and cook it as well. Drain the cooked rice and rinse it with cold water to keep it fluffy. Just drain the cooked broccoli.

Cut the schnitzels into strips or cubes and sauté in butter and olive oil for about ten minutes. Then add the rice and combine, then add the broccoli and mix everything well. If needed, season a little more, sprinkle with black sesame, and sauté everything together for another 5 minutes.
Serve slightly cooled.

dishes.name: Potatoes with Cooking Cream
preparation: Peel, wash, and slice the potatoes into rounds. Grease a baking dish with oil and arrange the potatoes. In a deeper bowl, pour in the cooking cream, add the milk, eggs, and mix with a fork. Then add the parmesan, salt, pepper, vegetable seasoning, mix, and pour over the potatoes. Cover with baking paper, then foil, and bake in a well-heated oven at 200 degrees for one hour. Then remove the foil and baking paper and bake for another 15 minutes at 180 degrees.
Remove from the oven and serve.

dishes.name: Minced Meat Patties
ingredients: 250 g mixed minced meat (beef and pork)
preparation: Remove the center from the slice of stale bread, soak it in warm milk, drain, and add it to the minced meat along with the grated carrot, grated onion, egg, and seasonings to taste: salt, pepper, vegetable seasoning, garlic, and oregano.
Mix everything well and let the mixture rest for about half an hour.
Form patties about 1 cm thick.
Fry in hot oil for 4-5 minutes on each side.
Remove the patties with a slotted spoon onto a paper towel to drain excess fat. Serve with a vegetable side dish, sauce, and salad.

dishes.name: Meatless Lunch
preparation: Peel the roasted peppers and clean them of seeds. Season with salt and add herbs. Mix. Spread the whole pepper, place a slice of ham and a piece of cheese, then roll it up like a little roll. Arrange the rolls in a baking dish next to each other. Bake at 200°C for about 10-15 minutes. It has a wonderful taste. Enjoy!
Instead of ham, you can also use roasted meat.

dishes.name: Moussaka with Potatoes and Mushrooms
preparation: Finely chop the onion and sauté it, then add the chopped mushrooms and sauté them a little as well. Then add the ground red pepper and rice and mix everything well. Season to taste. In a greased baking dish, arrange half of the sliced potatoes, then the mushroom mixture, and then another layer of potatoes. Pour in water to cover the potatoes and bake until the potatoes are soft and most of the water has evaporated.

dishes.name: Lenten Bean Stew (in Water)
preparation: Sort the beans, rinse them, add water, and bring to a boil. Drain that water, add fresh water, add the chopped onion, and add the chopped garlic, and you can also add a carrot, depending on your preference. Let it cook for at least two hours to cook well. Towards the end of cooking, make a roux. In a small bowl, mix two tablespoons of flour, paprika to taste, and dilute with a little water. Add this to the cooked beans as a roux, add a little tomato juice. Season with salt and pepper and add vegetable seasoning. Let it simmer a little longer. Serve hot with pickles or other salads you have.

dishes.name: Greek Meatballs
preparation: In oil, sauté 3 finely chopped onions, add the carrot sliced into rounds, and the pepper sliced into strips and sauté. Peel the tomatoes, chop them into cubes, and add them to the vegetables along with the sugar and sauté until the juice evaporates. Season with salt and pepper. To the meat, add 1 finely chopped onion and garlic, breadcrumbs, egg, salt, pepper, and mix well to form 12 meatballs. In a dish, place a few tablespoons of vegetables, arrange the meatballs, and pour the remaining vegetables over them. Beat the eggs with the milk and add a little salt. Pour over the meatballs. Bake at 200 degrees for 30 minutes.

dishes.name: Quick Chicken in Sauce
preparation: Peel the potatoes and cut them in half lengthwise and crosswise. Cook in salted water for 15-20 minutes.
Clean and cut the peppers into quarters. Halve them lengthwise and cut into 3 cm pieces.
Cut the chicken into 4 cm pieces, season with salt and pepper. Heat oil in a large skillet and fry the meat for 5 minutes until browned on all sides.

Add the peppers and fry for 2-3 minutes. Season with paprika, oregano, and a little salt. Drain the potatoes and mix them with the meat and peppers. Place everything in a greased baking dish (30x20cm).
Beat the cooking cream, milk, and eggs. Stir in the cheese, salt, and pepper. Pour the mixture over the chicken. Bake in a preheated oven at 200 degrees on the lower rack for 30 minutes.

dishes.name: Roasted Chicken with Potatoes
preparation: Clean, wash, and dry the chicken. Then rub it with spices, salt, and vegetable seasoning. Peel, wash, and cut the potatoes into thicker slices, peel, wash, and cut the onion into wedges, then mix together with the potatoes and season with vegetable seasoning, pepper, salt, and a little oil. Mix and place in a baking dish with the chicken and roast until the chicken is nicely cooked and golden yellow.

dishes.name: Pounded Schnitzels
preparation: Flatten the schnitzels with a meat mallet, but first season with salt and pepper to taste, then sprinkle with breadcrumbs. It is necessary to combine the meat and breadcrumbs with the mallet. Prepare the meat for frying. Dredge the meat in flour, then in eggs, and finally in breadcrumbs, and fry in fat until golden brown on both sides. Then arrange the schnitzels in a deep, lightly greased skillet with a lid. Add finely chopped garlic, dry seasoning, and pour in the wine. Then add water, enough to cover the meat and keep it moist. Let it simmer for about 30 minutes on low heat. Towards the end of cooking, add finely chopped parsley. Enjoy!! Serve with mashed potatoes.

dishes.name: Lenten Soy Schnitzels with Mustard and Sesame
preparation: Soak the soy schnitzels in water for 1-2 hours to swell. Then drain and wash the schnitzels. Bring 1.5 liters of water to a boil, add pepper, salt, and bay leaf. Add the soy schnitzels to the water and boil for about 15 minutes.
Drain again and squeeze the schnitzels well with your hands to remove excess water. Dry and lightly pound with a mallet.

Season the schnitzels with pepper, vegetable seasoning, salt, and spread mustard on both sides. In a plate, mix sesame and whole wheat flour, coat each schnitzel in the flour, and fry in heated oil. When the schnitzels turn golden, reduce the temperature. Serve the soy schnitzels with potatoes if desired.
